isis.stitle: 7 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER SERIES - REMOVE - MAINSHAFT

step1.para: Remove the spacer ( left, Figure 16) and reverse gear from the mainshaft ( right, Figure 16).
Remove the washer from the hub of the reverse gear ( Figure 17) and the snap ring from the reverse gear if necessary (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 16. Remove Spacer and Reverse Gear From Mainshaft
Figure 17. Remove Washer From Hub of Reverse Gear

step1.para: Cut lockwire, remove the bolt and 1st-reverse block ( Figure 18).
Remove the rear mainshaft key ( Figure 19).
Turn the tolerance washer to align the splines and remove from the mainshaft ( Figure 20).
Remove the shift fork, clutch and shift bar ( Figure 21). Cut the lockwire and remove the bolt and shift fork if necessary (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 21. Remove Shift Fork, Clutch and Shift Bar

step1.para: Rotate the tolerance washer inside the 1st speed gear ( inset, Figure 22). Remove the gear, washer and spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 22. Rotate Tolerance Washer, and Remove Gear, Washer, and Spacer

step1.para: Remove 1st and 2nd gear spacer from the mainshaft ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Remove 1st and 2nd Gear Spacer From Mainshaft

step1.para: Use a small screwdriver to remove the snap ring from inside the 2nd speed gear ( Figure 24).

figure.caption: Figure 24. Remove Snap Ring From Inside 2nd Speed Gear

step1.para: Move 2nd speed gear forward, engaging it into its clutch and against 3rd speed gear ( Figure 25). Remove the external splined spacer (inset).
Cut the lockwire, and remove the bearing retainer bolts and retainers from the rear of the countershafts ( Figure 26).

figure.caption: Figure 26. Remove Bearing Retainer Bolts and Retainers

step1.para: From inside the case, use a long punch and maul to drive the right countershaft rear bearing to the rear and from the case bore ( Figure 27). Use caution to avoid marring the case bore.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Drive Right Countershaft Rear Bearing to Rear

note.para: Remove procedures will damage the bearing. Removal should not be attempted unless replacement of the bearing is planned.

step1.para: Remove the snap rings from the front of both countershafts ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Remove Snap Rings From Front of Countershafts

step1.para: With a soft bar and maul, drive the right countershaft to the rear until front of countershaft is even with the front of the bearing ( Figure 29).

figure.caption: Figure 29. Drive Right Countershaft to Rear

step1.para: Drive against the rear of the right countershaft to move it as far forward as possible ( Figure 30). This will expose the front bearing snap ring (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 30. Drive Against Rear of Right Countershaft

step1.para: Use a bearing puller to remove the front countershaft bearing ( Figure 31).
Remove the retaining bolts, jar lightly to break the gasket seal and remove the front bearing cover ( Figure 32).
From inside the case, tap lightly against the back face of the drive gear until the input shaft assembly can be pulled by hand from case ( inset, Figure 33).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Tap Against Back Face of Drive Gear Until Input Shaft Assembly Can Be Pulled From Case

step1.para: Block right countershaft against the wall of the case ( inset, Figure 34). Hold 2nd speed gear against the 3rd speed gear, using a mainshaft hook on the front of the shaft. Tilt assembly up and lift it from the case. Use caution as 2nd speed gear is free to fall off the main shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 34. Block Right Countershaft Against Case Wall and Tilt Assembly Up
